channel.title: Comments on: Compile SASS files into one CSS file | Grunt JS Tutorial
channel.description: Manage Your Code Snippets with codeBelt | Code Examples / Tutorials / Articles

item.title: By: Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: I was unable to get my Sass files to watch and recompile upon changes, this was the one example I FINALLY ran across that worked! You have changed the entire process of our Web Development team here and I want to thank you.
item.content:encoded: I was unable to get my Sass files to watch and recompile upon changes, this was the one example I FINALLY ran across that worked! You have changed the entire process of our Web Development team here and I want to thank you.

item.title: By: Krunal Shah

item.description:
simple. concise. precise.
Thanks Robert for such a wonderful article. It saves my day.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Jamie Graham
item.dc:creator: Jamie Graham
item.description: You're right, after setting up the gruntjs file once or twice it becomes very quick to set up. Thanks for the tutorial.
item.content:encoded: You’re right, after setting up the gruntjs file once or twice it becomes very quick to set up. Thanks for the tutorial.

item.title: By: Doug Johnston
item.dc:creator: Doug Johnston
item.description: Thanks for the tutorial, this made setup of grunt and sass dead simple!
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the tutorial, this made setup of grunt and sass dead simple!
